title: MAINTENANCE TECHNICIAN / ENERGY MODULE
description:
MAINTENANCE SENIOR SPECIALIST / ENERGY MODULE
Innovative technologies and highly automated systems at the BMW Group ensure non-stop perfection every day. So that our production continues to run smoothly, we are looking for maintenance technicians for our plant in...Become part of our highly motivated team at the San Luis Potosi site and participate in the further expansion of internal plant engineering at our international locations. Work with us to build production systems for car body construction, electric drives (high-voltage storage and electric motor) and other technologies.

What awaits you?
• In a highly motivated production team, you will work on the series assembly of the Gen 6 energy module, where you will be responsible for error analysis and elimination in a highly automated environment to ensure high technical availability. You will also plan various maintenance activities for the production lines and special processes, including spare part administration and general maintenance material management. Additionally, you will optimize production processes and systems with operative maintenance, controls, and methodology.• You will also use maintenance-related systems (e.g., SAP) for your maintenance tasks, support all suppliers performing services in the assigned area and double-check the provided service, and support associates with technical problems, informing them about technical changes after a technology/production system update.• Finally, you will also participate in new project development with other departments to optimize production lines, focusing on technical availability and cycle time.
What you should bring along? • Technical education in mechanical, electrical, mechatronics, industrial chemistry, or a related field.• A bachelor's degree in engineering is desirable.• 3+ years of experience in maintaining highly automated production lines and planning maintenance, preferably in a manufacturing company.• Expert knowledge of special production processes• Experience in production with a very good understanding of manufacturing technology, e.g., in electromobility.• Be a structured and self-responsible employee.• Good communication and teamwork skills.• Basic English language skills.

Are you motivated and would you like to shape tomorrow's mobility with us?- Apply now!
At the BMW Group, we see diversity and inclusion in all its dimensions as a strength for our teams. Equal opportunities are a particular concern for us, and the equal treatment of applicants and employees is a fundamental principle of our corporate policy. That is why our recruiting decisions are also based on personality, experience and skills.Find out more about diversity at the BMW Group at: bmwgroup.jobs/diversity

title: Planning, Distribution & Ordering Trainee
description:
Knowing the destination isn't enough: you need to know how to get there. Build up your own networks, exploit new ideas, consistently take the initiative. Inspire other people with your enthusiasm. That's the only way to give ideas the power that allows them to become true innovations. We want to keep driving towards the future, so our team is currently seeking you as:
Planning, Distribution & Ordering Trainee.
As a Planning, Distribution and Ordering Trainee, you will responsible for support the achievement of sales volume, turnover and contribution margin target while maintaining a high level motivation of the dealer network.
Responsibilities.Support for achieving volume and contribution margin targets for corporate, direct and special sales as brand function (BMW Motorrad).Operate new motorcycles planning and ordering for the region exploiting market sales potential, maximizing turnover and contribution margin.Optimize the supply chain process within the markets.Support for the managing and optimizing the supply chain with relevant departments.Ensure planning and ordering maximizing sales potential and contribution margin.Support and enable the retail organization to reach targets in profitability and segment leadership.Achieve customer satisfaction targets sales.
Qualifications and experience.Bachelor's degree on Business Administration, Engineering or related field.Desirable automotive industry experience.Customer service skills (active listening, problem solving and ethics).Microsoft Office skills (PowerPoint, Word, and Excel).Fluent in English language.

title: CONTROLLING GLOBAL FINANCE BACKBONE (GFBB) COORDINATOR
description:
Always under control, always with passion: those who want to shape the future need to keep track especially when it comes to goal-oriented corporate management. Thanks to extensive training and qualified teams, our finance colleagues create decisive added value for the BMW Group anew every day because they know what really counts.
What awaits you? 
• Bridges the gap between market rollout teams and the central feature team, ensuring that project requirements are clearly defined and assigned.• Integrates business and technical aspects of the rollout into the overall project plan.• Establishes and implements standardized processes for the rollout.• Facilitates knowledge sharing between the feature team and market teams.• Supports the evaluation and approval of system gaps.• Maintains accurate records of system fit and gaps.• Conducts financial analysis, including budgeting, forecasting, and reporting.• Evaluates the financial impact of technology and process changes.• ets and monitors financial targets, developing strategies to achieve them.• Contributes to financial reports for both internal and external stakeholders.• Identifies opportunities to improve financial processes and reduce costs.• Leads initiatives to enhance financial control systems.• Promotes knowledge sharing and best practices among financial teams.
What you should bring along?
• A bachelor's degree in Economics, Business Administration, Finance, or a related field.• Proven experience in financial controlling and analysis.• Expertise in SAP financial systems.• A deep understanding of financial reporting and budgeting processes.• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.• Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.• A collaborative mindset and a passion for teamwork.• Fluent English level.

title: Quality Management Parts Coordinator - High Voltage Battery Housing & Stamping
description:
Product quality always begins at source – with procurement. That’s why it takes people with an uncompromising sense of standards, an exceptional mindset and a real feeling for quality to procure the most suitable materials for each and every part of our vehicles. But the job doesn’t just end there. In their pursuit of uncompromising quality, our teams are tasked with ensuring all the materials they source continue to drive more sustainable and efficient production methods too.
What awaits you?
• Drive the on-time industrialization of assigned component suppliers, ensuring they meet all project timelines.• Foster strong collaboration between our launch teams and the responsible Quality Management Parts at BMW plants. This includes operational work, pre-series execution, DOC attainment, ramp-up curve management, quality stabilization, and integration of decisions, measures, and agreements with suppliers.• Define and agree upon reliability indicators and critical quality characteristics with suppliers to guarantee the highest standards.• Proactively identify and resolve any issues related to component manufacturing processes, ensuring consistent quality throughout the project lifecycle. Document all measures taken from project launch to end of production (Production Quality Management, Inspection Procedure Qualification, etc.).• Secure parts availability for all production phases and events in BMW projects. Collaborate with suppliers to successfully execute pre-series processes before SOP (Start of Production).• Manage the part approval process and ISIR releases for assigned suppliers and components.• Partner with suppliers to identify root causes of problems and implement sustainable solutions.• Monitor and implement actions to achieve key performance indicators (KPIs) such as PPM, TecSa targets, and REQs.• Maintain clear and consistent communication with project partners and management, providing proactive updates and feedback.• Prepare regular status reports and strategic presentations on assigned projects.
What should you bring along?
• Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Mechatronic, Electronic, Chemical, or Industrial Engineering (preferred).• 3+ years of experience in quality management or a related field within the automotive manufacturing industry.• In-depth knowledge of the latest technological generations of High Voltage Battery systems.• Proven track record 8+ years of successfully industrializing suppliers for High Voltage Battery Housing and Progressive Stamping components (including conventional hot and cold stamping).• Demonstrated expertise in quality and project management principles.• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to handle complex tasks and a high volume of issues.• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with fluency in English.• Strong negotiation and moderation skills for effective collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.• Willingness to travel regularly (potentially weekly).• Ability to work effectively in a multicultural environment.
Are you motivated and would you like to shape tomorrow's mobility with us? - Apply now!

Equal opportunities are a particular concern for us, and the equal treatment of applicants and employees is a fundamental principle of our corporate policy. That is why our recruiting decisions are also based on personality, experience and skills.Find out more about diversity at the BMW Group at: bmwgroup.jobs/diversity

title: CONTROLS COORDINATOR FOR PAINTED BODY AND BODY
description:
When the goal is to ensure that each and every BMW delivers pure driving pleasure as standard, quality control is paramount. That’s why our quality standards are only ever as good as the sum of the personal standards of everyone who tests them. It’s why we value the passion and commitment of our quality experts so highly – and why their attention to the details ensures the quality of every single part of our vehicles.
What awaits you?
• Coordinate complex troubleshooting, leading teams, and report to management during breakdowns in the line.• You will be a technical leader and trainer for Controls Specialists and Maintenance Technicians in small projects and improvement projects."• Provide project planning, installation, start-up, and acceptance, as well as engineering support for new installations and optimization measures of the conveyor and equipment technology in Painted Body.• Drive and perform all aspects of project management, from the early concept, design, and implementation phases until completion and handover to the customer, including series production support issues.• Manage change order requests, punch list resolution activities, and adherence to project investment budgets and schedules.
What you should bring along?
• Bachelor's degree in Electrical, Mechatronics, Automation Engineering, or a related field.• 5+ years of experience in controls engineering in the automotive industry and safety equipment.• 3+ years of experience in project management for several equipment and/or controls planning projects, as well as structural modification.• Knowledge of Siemens TIA Portal PLC programming, including S7Graph, PDiag, SCL, Distributed Safety, WinCC or WinCC Flexible visualization, industrial communication (Profibus, ProfiNet, CAN-Bus, SERCOS), and KUKA/ABB robots programming.• Fluent in business English.
Are you motivated and would you like to shape tomorrow's mobility with us? - Apply now!

title: Coord. Information Technology (SAP)
description:
Coord. Information Technology.
As a Coord IT you will be responsible for developing, implementing, and operating information technology services and processes in own area of responsibility with the focus on providing business continuity and efficiencies. Also, you will be in charge of the software engineering in Enterprise Resource Planning systems.
Responsibilities.Manage the software integration, external interface development, and technical documentation in own area of responsibility. May code individual modules and complex functions in ERP (SAP) systems and applications.Develop and build application tables, panels, programs, and reports for ERP (SAP) based systems and projects in own area of responsibility.Ensure effective systems change control, problem management, and incident management; thereby reducing risk, ensuring quality, and business continuity.Operate at the highest technical level of all phases of ERP/SAP client/server enterprise application activities.Develop and manage project plans to include defining deliverables, budget adherence, key milestones and critical paths.Ensures the integrity, reliability, and reproduction of our internally and externally developed software products.Promote and facilitate the use of the Agile methodology for all initiatives and tasks.
Qualifications and experience.Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or Engineering.5+ Years of demonstrated experience in IT area.3+ Years in a mid-level software engineering role.2+ Years writing software for enterprise ERP systems in Java/ABAP.1+ Years working in Agile feature teamsFluent in English.

title: MASTER TRAINER - CONTROLS COORDINATOR / ENERGY MODULE
description:
At BMW, it’s easy to stay right on track. Like every car on our production line. Innovative technologies and highly automated systems at the BMW Group ensure non-stop perfection every day. So that our production continues to run smoothly, we are looking for maintenance technicians for our plant in...
What awaits you? 
Develop and execute a comprehensive control training strategy for bodyshop, paintshop, and energy module production technologies.Own and manage all controls technologies and maintenance activities, including firmware/hardware updates, program/logic modifications, network configurations, and digitalization initiatives.Collaborate with the planning department on equipment integration, installation, validation, and acceptance processes.Drive equipment uptime and performance by analyzing downtime and faults, implementing preventive maintenance strategies, and leading improvement projects.
What should you bring along?
Bachelor's degree in Controls Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Robotics, Automotive/Automation Engineering, Mechatronics, or a related field.Minimum of 6 years of hands-on controls engineering experience in the automotive industry or a similar high-tech environment.Proven expertise in safety systems (PLC, robot, drives), preferably within a production, planning, or maintenance context.Fluency in English.

title: Quality Management Parts Injection Molding and Polymers Senior Specialist / HV Battery Module
description:
There are no limits to our e-mobility experts' progressive thinking. With their unique instinct for innovative solutions, they work on developing the mobility of tomorrow. They endeavor to advance future technologies day in, day out, driven by the passion to continuously expand our exciting portfolio of electric vehicles.
What awaits you?
• Strategically select and evaluate potential suppliers for e-mobility components, ensuring alignment with our stringent quality requirements.• Lead comprehensive 360° assessments to identify and develop the capabilities of our supplier network.• Implement proactive quality checks throughout the supplier nomination process to mitigate potential risks.• Develop and manage supplier partnerships, guiding them towards achieving our high quality standards and optimizing their production processes.• Drive successful ramp-up (industrialization) of production for assigned components, ensuring on-time delivery.• Collaborate with suppliers to define critical quality characteristics (CQs) and reliability indicators, fostering a shared understanding of success.• Proactively identify and resolve quality issues related to the manufacturing process. Document all corrective actions for continuous improvement.• Guarantee parts availability to meet production demands and key milestones for BMW project launches.• Guide suppliers through pre-production (SOP) with expertise, ensuring a smooth transition to full-scale manufacturing.• Partner with suppliers to identify root causes of problems and implement sustainable solutions to prevent future occurrences.• Maintain clear and consistent communication with suppliers, project teams, and management, providing timely feedback to optimize collaboration.
What should you bring along?
• Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Mechatronic, Electronic, Chemical, Industrial Engineering, or a related field.• Proven track record of at least 5 years' experience in industrializing suppliers for High Voltage Battery components or a similar field.• In-depth knowledge of the latest technological generations of Automotive High Voltage Batteries.• Expert understanding of injection molding processes and the chemical behavior of polymers used in High Voltage Battery Modules.• 3+ in automotive manufacturing quality processes, component expertise, and relevant part technologies and processes.• Demonstrated knowledge of quality and project management principles.• Ability to manage complex tasks and issues efficiently and prioritize effectively.• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with fluency in English.• Willingness to travel regularly (potentially weekly) for on-site supplier collaboration.• Analytical and structured approach to problem-solving and project management.• Enthusiasm for teamwork and a commitment to working effectively in a multicultural environment.

title: SECURITY OPERATIONS COORDINATOR
description:
What awaits you?
• Lead and coordinate security risk management for Plant SLP associates, assets, operations, and suppliers beyond the plant location.• Oversee budget planning, expenses, and forecasting for external security services. Develop and steer an annual security program, delivering regular reports on relevant activities, incidents, budget, projects, and program status.• Establish and manage KPIs to measure the effectiveness of security activities, incident response, budget control, and program progress.• Coordinate the annual security program and activities with relevant teams within Plant SLP, CDMX and regional security functions.• Participate in expert exchanges with other BMW Security functions and Centers of Competence, sharing knowledge and best practices.• Conduct security assessments for expat locations and activities, including residences. Provide security briefings, inductions, and ongoing support.• Assess security risks for business travel destinations and activities. Conduct security briefings for foreign travelers and Plant SLP associates traveling within Mexico. Define, coordinate, and implement security measures for travel to high-risk destinations.• Provide expert advice during incidents or emergencies and coordinate immediate and follow-up actions.• Evaluate security vulnerabilities for suppliers, transportation contractors, and their routes. Develop, implement, and maintain security plans. Conduct security reviews and audits at supplier locations.• Respond to security incidents with expert advice and coordinate actions at the incident location.• Support the development and execution of crisis scenarios, action plans, and exercises. Collaborate with management and the Local Crisis Management Team during real crisis situations.• Monitor security developments related to Plant SLP's external business activities. Alert relevant stakeholders to significant security events and conduct threat assessments.• Effectively liaise with authorities, partners, and peers on security risk management, best practices, and special subjects.• Conduct security assessments for prototype activities outside Plant SLP. Provide security briefings and coordinate measures to safeguard prototypes.• Participate in investigations of criminal activities against BMW personnel or assets outside Plant SLP.
What should you bring along?
• 6+ years of experience in a security environment, coordinating security risk management, incident management, and investigations.• Proven track record in supply chain risk management (preferred).• Military or police background is a strong asset.• Expertise in designing, implementing, and maintaining comprehensive security programs and processes.• Demonstrated ability to effectively manage security incidents, including leading investigations, coordinating response efforts, and implementing corrective actions.• Strong analytical skills to identify, assess, and mitigate security risks across various business activities.• Ability to leverage security intelligence and data analysis to inform strategic decision-making and program effectiveness.• Experience in developing and implementing clear, concise, and enforceable security policies and procedures.• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.• Willingness to travel occasionally outside the plant.• English advanced.

title: FIRE PROTECTION TECHNOLOGY SENIOR SPECIALIST
description:
Nothing is more important than safety. As a leading manufacturer of mobility solutions, we care about protecting our colleagues, sites and the environment. That's why our fire protection needs to meet the very highest standards.
What awaits you?
• Plan and supervise all maintenance activities of the fire alarm system (FAS) and fire protection system (FPS).• Oversee the equipment of the Plant SLP Fire Brigade.• Implement and maintain instructions, tools, and documentation for hot work• Conduct training for relevant BMW associates and third-party staff on the operation and maintenance of FAS/FPS.• Support internal and external audits on fire protection, civil protection, and emergency response.• Liaise and exchange with other Fire Protection experts in BMW and with suppliers/contractors and other peer companies on FAS and FPS technology matters.• Maintain documentation on status of Hot Works, maintenance and related KPIs and prepare related regular and on-demand reporting.
What should you bring along?
• 3+ years of experience working with Fire Alarm Systems.• Expert knowledge in relevant regulations, norms and standards, including related NOMS, NFPA.• Fluent in English• Passionate for all matters related to processes, organization, management systems, auditing.• Strong communication and report writing skills.• Strong networking/problem solving/proactive skills.• Solid skills in MS-Office applications including SAP and Share Point.• Good administrative skills including budgeting, planning and projects.• Open minded and engaging.• "Hands on" mentality.

title: Parts Advisor Apprentice
description:
BMW Park Royal is looking for an Aftersales Parts Advisor Apprentice.

Your role

We are currently recruiting for an Aftersales Customer Service (Parts Advisor) Trainee. The successful applicant will have the opportunity to work with one of the world's most prestigious and technologically advanced car manufacturers.

You will be working in a busy BMW/MINI Parts Department. Parts Advisor specific duties include:

 Interaction with both Trade and Retail customers – you will be working with customers on a daily basis both over the phone and face-to-face, to provide them with information and to sell them parts and accessories. Stock – this includes stock control and checks, as well as being responsible for ordering parts stock to be delivered at required times. Computer Systems – you will work on specialised computer systems, including computerised stock management systems and parts identification programmes. Vehicle Service / Sales support – you will support other Departments within the BMW Retailer, including workshop staff, to ensure they function effectively.

All Aftersales Customer Service (Parts Advisor) Trainees attend the BMW Group Academy UK in Berkshire for their off-the-job training. The apprenticeship will have a strong focus on the retail environment and the high customer service expectations of BMW & MINI customers, as well as Service Advisor specific training. The training takes place over a 12 month period at the BMW Group Academy and has been designed to suit both Parts and Service Advisor roles.

During the time spent at your BMW Retailer, a mentor will be allocated to oversee the work-based learning programme. A BMW representative will also visit on a 12 weekly basis to set performance targets and ensure any development needs are being met.

Requirements and prospects

Personal qualities

Successful Applicants Must Demonstrate The Following

 An enthusiasm for excellent customer service. An interest in the automotive industry. To have good communication and organisational skills. To be honest and trustworthy with a willingness to learn. To have a positive attitude and work ethic, with high level of professionalism to represent the BMW/MINI brand. To be able to work effectively as part of a team in a busy parts department, as well as having the capability to follow instructions and work individually.

Desired Qualifications

Applicants are required to have, or predicted to obtain, GCSE Grade A*-C / 9 - 4 / or Functional Skills Level 2 (or equivalent) in the following subjects:

 English Maths One other subject

Future prospects

On successful completion of the apprenticeship, you will be a qualified Parts Advisor. You will also gain a Level 2 Customer Service Practitioner. Following this, there are various opportunities for progression within the Retailer.

Things to consider

Successful applicants must be prepared to travel to the BMW Group Academy in Berkshire to complete their apprenticeship training. Training is completed in one-week blocks approximately once every two months as well as virtual classroom training online.

All training costs are covered by the BMW Retailer (travel, accommodation and food).

About The Employer

All Light Vehicle Technician, Aftersales Customer Service (Parts & Service) and Motorcycle Technician Apprentices will be employed at their local BMW Retailer, and will attend the BMW Group Academy for their training. The BMW Group Academy is based at Wokefield Park near Reading in Berkshire. All Bodyshop Technician (Paint & Panel) Apprentices will be employed at their local BMW Retailer or Bodyshop, and will attend our body training facility for their training. The body training facility is located in Milton Keynes.

Training provider

While the programme will focus around customer service skills, also embedded within the seven weeks training will include the current certification training courses for the Parts Advisor role. Additional technical and product awareness training will also be included.

Qualifications To Be Achieved

 Level 2 Customer Service Practitioner Parts Advisor Certification ERR (Employee Rights & Responsibilities) Workbook

Training provider

INSPIRO LEARNING LIMITED

Applications for this apprenticeship are being processed by BMW Group Academy

title: BMW Vehicle Technician
description:
Park Lane Aftersales is looking for a Vehicle Technician.

Your role

Working on the electrical and mechanical systems for a range of BMW & MINI models, every day will be packed with variety. With our diagnostic technology at your fingertips, you’ll inspect components for wear and tear, carry out technical maintenance, repair or replace parts, as well as verifying vehicle functions and their subsystems.

Your profile

Your technical or vocational training in an automotive retailer or similar environment will be backed by experience working with prestige vehicles. A full driving licence is essential. We’ll also expect you to be a team player who’s continually focused on the needs of customers. Be a BMW Certified Technician.

Working Hours

40 Hrs per week, Monday to Friday , 8.00am - 17.00pm.Saturday working ( as per rota).25 Days annual leave, plus bank holidays.

Rewards

BMW Group Car & Bike Scheme.BMW Group Pension Employer Contribution from 8% - 16%.BMW Career Progression.

title: Senior Vehicle Technician
description:
Park Lane Aftersales is looking for a Senior Technician.

Your role

You’ll work on electrical, electronic, hydraulic, pneumatic, and mechanical systems for a range of BMW & MINI models. With our diagnostic technology at your fingertips, you’ll inspect components for wear and tear, carry out technical maintenance, repair or replace parts, as well as verifying vehicle functions and their subsystems and performing retrofitting work. We’ll also look to you to support and guide other technicians and apprentices.

Your profile

Your technical or vocational training in an automotive retailer or similar environment will be backed by extensive experience working with prestige vehicles. A full driving licence is essential. A genuine team player who loves to share your knowledge with others, you’re continually focused on the needs of customers.

Working Hours

40 Hrs per week, Monday to Friday , 8.00am - 17.00pm.Saturday working ( as per rota).25 Days annual leave, plus bank holidays.

Rewards

BMW Group Car & Bike Scheme.BMW Group Pension Employer Contribution from 8% - 16%.BMW Career Progression.

title: Programador PLC para Robots certificados por BMW
description:
Posición: Programador de PLC/Robots certificados por BMW 
Referencia: ROBMW-RI-R0019-EUA
Lugar de trabajo: Charleston, Carolina del sur, Estados Unidos. 
Descripción: Importante empresa dedicada a soluciones de automatización, se encuentra en búsqueda de Programadores de robots certificados por BMW para un proyecto temporal en Charleston, Carolina del Sur, Estados Unidos. 
Los candidatos seleccionados serán responsables de la programación, configuración y puesta en marcha de sistemas de automatización industrial, garantizando el cumplimiento de los estándares de calidad y seguridad establecidos por BMW y nuestros proveedores de tecnología.Responsabilidades y funciones principales:Programar y configurar sistemas de PLC y robots de acuerdo con los estándares y especificaciones técnicas de BMW.Realizar pruebas y validaciones de sistemas, asegurando la funcionalidad y eficiencia de los mismos.Colaborar con equipos de ingeniería y proveedores para solucionar problemas técnicos y optimizar procesos.Documentar procedimientos y configuraciones, manteniendo registros precisos y actualizados.
Requisitos:Visa TN vigente para trabajar en los Estados Unidos.Disponibilidad para trabajar por un proyecto de 1 mes en Charleston, Carolina del sur, Estados Unidos.Obligatorio poseer certificaciones de BMW en: SAS-Hardware/EPLAN.WTB SAS/ SOV Basic Controls.TKB Commissioning training
Certificaciones: KUKA Prog.1KUKA Safe Operation training por KUKAExperiencia: Conocimientos Técnicos:SAS E-plan y SAS export files: Dominio en el uso y manejo de archivos de exportación SAS (carpeta de commissioning) es esencial.Manejo de EPLAN: Competencia en el uso de software EPLAN para la planificación y documentación de proyectos eléctricos y de automatización.Experiencia en Robótica: Habilidad para trabajar con proveedores de robótica y manejar adecuadamente los archivos y configuraciones necesarias para la integración de sistemas.
Estudios: Ingeniería en software, Ingeniería Electrónica Industrial y Automática.
Idiomas: Inglés Intermedio (habilidad para comunicarse de manera efectiva en inglés, tanto escrito como hablado).
Ofrecemos: Sueldo base conforme a la experiencia demostrada. Oportunidad de trabajar en un entorno dinámico y especializado. Los programadores de robots recibirán capacitación A01 en la planta de BMW

description:
Importante empresa dedicada a soluciones de automatización, se encuentra en búsqueda de Programadores de robots certificados por BMW para un proyecto temporal en Charleston, Carolina del Sur, Estados Unidos. 

Los candidatos seleccionados serán responsables de la programación, configuración y puesta en marcha de sistemas de automatización industrial, garantizando el cumplimiento de los estándares de calidad y seguridad establecidos por BMW y nuestros proveedores de tecnología.

Programar y configurar sistemas de PLC y robots de acuerdo con los estándares y especificaciones técnicas de BMW.Realizar pruebas y validaciones de sistemas, asegurando la funcionalidad y eficiencia de los mismos.Colaborar con equipos de ingeniería y proveedores para solucionar problemas técnicos y optimizar procesos.Documentar procedimientos y configuraciones, manteniendo registros precisos y actualizados.

Requisitos:

Visa TN vigente para trabajar en los Estados Unidos.Disponibilidad para trabajar por un proyecto de 1 mes en Charleston, Carolina del sur, Estados Unidos.Obligatorio poseer certificaciones de BMW en: SAS-Hardware/EPLAN.WTB SAS/ SOV Basic Controls.TKB Commissioning trainingCertificaciones: KUKA Prog.1KUKA Safe Operation training por KUKA

Experiencia: 

Conocimientos Técnicos:SAS E-plan y SAS export files: Dominio en el uso y manejo de archivos de exportación SAS (carpeta de commissioning) es esencial.Manejo de EPLAN: Competencia en el uso de software EPLAN para la planificación y documentación de proyectos eléctricos y de automatización.Experiencia en Robótica: Habilidad para trabajar con proveedores de robótica y manejar adecuadamente los archivos y configuraciones necesarias para la integración de sistemas.

Estudios:  Ingeniería en software, Ingeniería Electrónica Industrial y Automática o Técnico Superior en Automatización y Robótica Industrial.

Idiomas: Inglés Intermedio (habilidad para comunicarse de manera efectiva en inglés, tanto escrito como hablado).

Ofrecemos:

Sueldo base conforme a la experiencia demostrada. Oportunidad de trabajar en un entorno dinámico y especializado. Los programadores de robots recibirán capacitación A01 en la planta de BMW.
